#Text=IV
#Text=He was a young man with an eager soul , and his work in Apple Blossom Court and places like it had torn him many ways .
#Text=Religious conventions established through centuries of custom had not prepared him for life among the submerged .
#Text=He had struggled and been appalled , he had wrestled in prayer and felt himself unanswered , and in repentance of the feeling had scourged himself with thorns .
#Text=Miss Montaubyn , returning from the hospital , had filled him at first with horror and protest .
#Text=" But who knows -- who knows ?

#Text= he said to Dart , as they stood and talked together afterward , " Faith as a little child .

column1: #Text=That is literally hers .
#Text=And I was shocked by it -- and tried to destroy it , until I suddenly saw what I was doing .
#Text=I was -- in my cloddish egotism -- trying to show her that she was irreverent BECAUSE she could believe what in my soul I do not , though I dare not admit so much even to myself .
#Text=She took from some strange passing visitor to her tortured bedside what was to her a revelation .
#Text=She heard it first as a child hears a story of magic .
#Text=When she came out of the hospital , she told it as if it was one . I -- I -- " he bit his lips and moistened them , " argued with her and reproached her .
#Text=Christ the Merciful , forgive me !

#Text=She sat in her squalid little room with her magic -- sometimes in the dark -- sometimes without fire , and she clung to it , and loved it and asked it to help her , as a child asks its father for bread .

#Text=When she was answered -- and God forgive me again for doubting that the simple good that came to her WAS an answer -- when any small help came to her , she was a radiant thing , and without a shadow of doubt in her eyes told me of it as proof -- proof that she had been heard .
#Text=When things went wrong for a day and the fire was out again and the room dark , she said , ' I ' ave n't kept near enough -- I ' ave n't trusted TRUE .
#Text=It will be gave me soon , ' and when once at such a time I said to her , ' We must learn to say , Thy will be done , ' she smiled up at me like a happy baby and answered :
#Text=" '

#Text= If you will come upstairs with me to the room where the girl Glad lives , I will tell you , " he said , " but before we go I want to hand something over to you .
